oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Store ledger of Thomas Forkner
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Forkner lived on Forked Creek in Monroe County, Tennessee. He owned a store and never joined either army. He went to work in Craighead Cave (Lost Sea) mining saltpetre to avoid fighting. The entries reflect the costs of items available in a dry goods store in 1865. Items listed include shirting material, geanes (jeans) pants, linen, galases (galluses), tobacco as well as costs for mending and sewing various garments.
